title: Grilled Cheese Muffin Cups

ingredients.item: of artisanal bread , cut into 1-inch pieces

ingredients.notes: such as Emmental or Sbrinz work well too

instructions: Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C). Line a standard 12-cup muffin tin with parchment paper.
In a small saucepan, caramelize the onions over medium heat for 20-25 minutes, stirring occasionally. Add the granulated sugar and cook for an additional 5 minutes. Set aside to cool.
In a separate pan, melt 1/4 cup (1/2 stick) of butter over medium heat. Add the bread pieces and toast until golden brown, about 3-4 minutes per side. Set aside.

In the same pan used for the bread, add the remaining 1/4 cup (1/2 stick) of butter. Once melted, sprinkle the Gruyère cheese over the bottom of each muffin cup. Top with a toasted bread piece and a spoonful of caramelized onions. Drizzle with fig jam.
Sprinkle the Parmesan cheese over the top of each muffin cup. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Bake for 12-15 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
